intro: Relbunium croceum, commonly known as the yellow relbunium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Relbunium croceum is often used in wildflower gardens for its delicate appearance and ecological benefits.
